title: FBI did not send undercover agents to join January 6 Capitol attack: Watchdog report
content: A Justice Department report debunks claims of FBI involvement in the January 6 Capitol attack. Investigators found no undercover agents or informants instigating violence, despite the presence of 26 FBI informants in D.C. that day. Though one informant entered the Capitol, none acted on FBI instructions.
summary: A Justice Department report debunks claims of FBI involvement in the January 6 Capitol attack. Investigators found no undercover agents or informants instigating violence, despite the presence of 26 FBI informants in D.C. that day. Though one informant entered the Capitol, none acted on FBI instructions.

title: ‘Vanderpump Rules’ actor James Kennedy arrested for domestic violence: Report
content: Former "Vanderpump Rules" star James Kennedy was arrested Tuesday night in Burbank for alleged misdemeanor domestic violence. Police responded to a private residence after a witness reported Kennedy being physical with an unidentified woman. Kennedy was released on bail, and the case is under review. The incident followed a holiday party where Kennedy reportedly displayed erratic behavior.
summary: Former "Vanderpump Rules" star James Kennedy was arrested Tuesday night in Burbank for alleged misdemeanor domestic violence. Police responded to a private residence after a witness reported Kennedy being physical with an unidentified woman. Kennedy was released on bail, and the case is under review. The incident followed a holiday party where Kennedy reportedly displayed erratic behavior.

title: ‘We're going to have a big discussion’: Trump signals vaccine policy review with RFK Jr
content: President-elect Donald Trump is considering changes to childhood vaccination programs, citing concerns about autism rates. He plans to discuss the matter with HHS nominee Robert F. Kennedy Jr., a known vaccine skeptic. Kennedy's potential appointment raises concerns among health experts due to his controversial views contradicting scientific consensus on vaccine safety.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump is considering changes to childhood vaccination programs, citing concerns about autism rates. He plans to discuss the matter with HHS nominee Robert F. Kennedy Jr., a known vaccine skeptic.  Kennedy's potential appointment raises concerns among health experts due to his controversial views contradicting scientific consensus on vaccine safety.

title: ‘Ladies' man for sure’: This is how Barron Trump’s college life is going, claims source
content: Barron Trump, the 18-year-old son of Donald and Melania Trump, is making a splash at NYU's Stern School of Business. Popular among students, he's balancing college life with his family's political spotlight. While enjoying his studies and New York City living, Barron also played a key advisory role in his father's 2024 presidential campaign.
summary: Barron Trump, the 18-year-old son of Donald and Melania Trump, is making a splash at NYU's Stern School of Business.  Popular among students, he's balancing college life with his family's political spotlight.  While enjoying his studies and New York City living, Barron also played a key advisory role in his father's 2024 presidential campaign.

title: 'It's crazy': Trump slams Ukraine's use of US missiles for strikes deep into Russia
content: President-elect Trump criticizes US long-range missile deployment in Ukraine, calling it "crazy" and escalatory. He vows not to abandon Ukraine, aiming for a swift peace agreement, but remains vague on details. Concerns arise in Kyiv over potential peace terms as the war intensifies with Russia's hypersonic missile deployment and increased US arms support.
summary: President-elect Trump criticizes US long-range missile deployment in Ukraine, calling it "crazy" and escalatory.  He vows not to abandon Ukraine, aiming for a swift peace agreement, but remains vague on details.  Concerns arise in Kyiv over potential peace terms as the war intensifies with Russia's hypersonic missile deployment and increased US arms support.

title: Indian student killed by falling tree in Canada's British Columbia, family seeks help
content: 22-year-old Indian student Rittika Rajput tragically died in British Columbia, Canada, after a falling tree struck her during a bonfire with friends. A GoFundMe campaign aims to repatriate her body to India and support her grieving family, who are struggling with the sudden loss and associated financial burdens.
summary: 22-year-old Indian student Rittika Rajput tragically died in British Columbia, Canada, after a falling tree struck her during a bonfire with friends.  A GoFundMe campaign aims to repatriate her body to India and support her grieving family, who are struggling with the sudden loss and associated financial burdens.

title: Respiratory illnesses soar in Pakistan as dust pollution and poverty worsen health crisis
Kurdish-led Syria force 'critical' to blocking IS resurgence: Blinken
content: During a visit to Jordan, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken emphasized the Syrian Democratic Forces' (SDF) crucial role in preventing the resurgence of ISIS in Syria.
summary: During a visit to Jordan, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken emphasized the Syrian Democratic Forces' (SDF) crucial role in preventing the resurgence of ISIS in Syria.

title: Can Javier Milei’s fiscal reforms inspire Musk and Ramaswamy’s DOGE agenda?
content: Argentina, under President Milei, achieved its first fiscal surplus in over a century through spending cuts and eliminating monetary emission. Inspired by this, Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy are leading the DOGE initiative in the US to tackle government waste, echoing Milei's approach. While facing challenges, DOGE aims to streamline federal spending and address the US's growing deficit.
summary: Argentina, under President Milei, achieved its first fiscal surplus in over a century through spending cuts and eliminating monetary emission.  Inspired by this, Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy are leading the DOGE initiative in the US to tackle government waste, echoing Milei's approach. While facing challenges, DOGE aims to streamline federal spending and address the US's growing deficit.

title: 'Anything can happen': Donald Trump on possibility of war with Iran
content: In a recent Time interview, President-elect Trump, named Person of the Year, stated that "anything can happen" regarding potential conflict with Iran, calling the situation "very volatile." He surprisingly pointed to Ukraine firing missiles into Russia as a major escalation.
summary: In a recent Time interview, President-elect Trump, named Person of the Year, stated that "anything can happen" regarding potential conflict with Iran, calling the situation "very volatile." He surprisingly pointed to Ukraine firing missiles into Russia as a major escalation.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta donates $1 million to Donald Trump's inauguration fund
content: Meta, Facebook's parent company, donated $1 million to Donald Trump's second-term inauguration fund after CEO Mark Zuckerberg met with the president-elect. Zuckerberg reportedly expressed support for Trump's economic plans, despite past tensions. This marks a shift from Meta's previous stance of not donating to presidential inaugurations.
summary: Meta, Facebook's parent company, donated $1 million to Donald Trump's second-term inauguration fund after CEO Mark Zuckerberg met with the president-elect.  Zuckerberg reportedly expressed support for Trump's economic plans, despite past tensions.  This marks a shift from Meta's previous stance of not donating to presidential inaugurations.

title: Trump celebrates Time's 'Person of the Year' by ringing NYSE opening bell
Podcast host Alex Cooper questions Harris' campaign spending on ‘Call Her Daddy’ set
content: Podcast host Alex Cooper expressed surprise at the $100,000 cost of recreating her studio for Kamala Harris's campaign appearance, calling the set "not that nice." Harris's campaign faced criticism for extravagant spending, including a Vegas display and extensive advertising, despite raising billions.
summary: Podcast host Alex Cooper expressed surprise at the $100,000 cost of recreating her studio for Kamala Harris's campaign appearance, calling the set "not that nice." Harris's campaign faced criticism for extravagant spending, including a Vegas display and extensive advertising, despite raising billions.

title: ‘Horrific crime’: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on puberty blockers following UK ban
content: Elon Musk condemned puberty blockers as a "horrific crime" after the UK banned their use for children under 18, citing safety concerns. Musk's stance stems from personal experience with his transgender child. The ban, while praised by some as a protective measure, faces criticism from transgender advocates. The UK plans further clinical trials to assess the treatment's efficacy.
summary: Elon Musk condemned puberty blockers as a "horrific crime" after the UK banned their use for children under 18, citing safety concerns.  Musk's stance stems from personal experience with his transgender child. The ban, while praised by some as a protective measure, faces criticism from transgender advocates.  The UK plans further clinical trials to assess the treatment's efficacy.

title: Iranian singer Parastoo Ahmadi performs online concert without hijab, faces prosecution
Concern over Syria's chemical weapons stockpile triggers emergency meeting of global monitor
content: The Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) convened an urgent meeting to address Syria's chemical weapons stockpile following President Assad's overthrow. The OPCW, which previously confirmed Syria's use of chemical weapons during the civil war, seeks access to investigate under the new transitional government.
summary: The Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) convened an urgent meeting to address Syria's chemical weapons stockpile following President Assad's overthrow. The OPCW, which previously confirmed Syria's use of chemical weapons during the civil war, seeks access to investigate under the new transitional government.

title: Donald Trump extends inauguration invite to China's Xi Jinping, other world leaders
content: US President-elect Donald Trump has invited Chinese President Xi Jinping and other world leaders to his inauguration on January 20. While Xi's response remains pending, the Kremlin confirmed no invitation has been extended to Russian President Vladimir Putin. Trump's team emphasised this outreach signifies his willingness to engage with both allies and adversaries, prioritizing American interests.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump has invited Chinese President Xi Jinping and other world leaders to his inauguration on January 20.  While Xi's response remains pending, the Kremlin confirmed no invitation has been extended to Russian President Vladimir Putin. Trump's team emphasised this outreach signifies his willingness to engage with both allies and adversaries, prioritizing American interests.

title: 2-year-old accidently shoots and kills mom in US apartment; boyfriend arrested
content: A two-year-old child in Fresno, California, fatally shot his 22-year-old mother, Jessinya Mina, with an unsecured handgun. The child's father, 18-year-old Andrew Sanchez, was arrested and charged with criminal storage of a firearm and child endangerment. Police emphasized the importance of safe gun storage, calling the incident preventable.
summary: A two-year-old child in Fresno, California, fatally shot his 22-year-old mother, Jessinya Mina, with an unsecured handgun. The child's father, 18-year-old Andrew Sanchez, was arrested and charged with criminal storage of a firearm and child endangerment. Police emphasized the importance of safe gun storage, calling the incident preventable.

title: Syria's new govt says to suspend constitution, parliament for three months
content: Following President Bashar al-Assad's ouster and the rebel takeover of Damascus, Syria's constitution and parliament will be suspended for three months. A new "Salvation Government" has appointed Mohammed al-Bashir as interim prime minister. A committee will review and amend the constitution during this transition, with a focus on upholding the rule of law and existing freedoms.
summary: Following President Bashar al-Assad's ouster and the rebel takeover of Damascus, Syria's constitution and parliament will be suspended for three months.  A new "Salvation Government" has appointed Mohammed al-Bashir as interim prime minister.  A committee will review and amend the constitution during this transition, with a focus on upholding the rule of law and existing freedoms.

title: EU lets Bulgaria, Romania fully integrate into Europe's ID-check-free travel zone
content: Bulgaria and Romania will gain full access to Europe's Schengen free-travel zone starting January 1, 2024. EU ministers lifted land border controls after previous concerns about migrant prevention were addressed. This decision promises economic benefits, faster travel, and reduced border wait times for both countries and the wider Schengen area.
summary: Bulgaria and Romania will gain full access to Europe's Schengen free-travel zone starting January 1, 2024.  EU ministers lifted land border controls after previous concerns about migrant prevention were addressed. This decision promises economic benefits, faster travel, and reduced border wait times for both countries and the wider Schengen area.
